00017     class vertex_data: public RotopeBase {
00018 
00019         public:
00020             virtual void print();           
00021 
00022         protected:
00023 
00025 
00026             vertex_data():
00027                     _dimension(0), _X(), _surface() {
00028                 X().push_back(VecMath::Vector<D>());
00029             }

00032             virtual void addSurface(unsigned, unsigned, unsigned, unsigned);
00034             virtual void addSurface(unsigned, unsigned, unsigned);

00056 /*  You shouldn't use "using" directives in a header file, but the code gets
00057     nearly unreadable otherwise:
00058     typename std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> >::iterator i = _X.begin();
00059     And because I'm defining template classes here, code must be written in the
00060     header file anyway.
00061 */
00062 using VecMath::Vector;
00063 using std::vector;
00064 
00065 #include <iomanip>
00066 
00067 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::print() {
00068     std::cerr << _dimension << "-dimensional object: ";
00069     std::string separator = "";
00070     for(typename vector<Vector<D> >::iterator i = X().begin();
00071         i != X().end(); ++i){
00072         std::cerr << separator << *i;
00073         separator = ", ";
00074     }
00075     std::cerr << "\n";
00076 
00077 #   if 1
00078         std::cerr << "Surfaces: \n";
00079         for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00080             std::cerr << std::setw(4) << i << " (";
00081             separator = "";
00082             for (uintvec1D::iterator j = surface()[i].begin();
00083                  j != surface()[i].end(); ++j) {
00084                 std::cerr << separator << std::setw(4) << *j;
00085                 separator = ", ";
00086             }
00087             std::cerr << ")\n";
00088         }
00089         std::cerr << "\n";
00090 #   endif
00091 
00092 }

00100 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00101                                                       unsigned v3, unsigned v4) {
00102     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() ||
00103         v3 >= X().size() || v4 >= X().size()) {
00104         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00105                                 "than size of vertex array");
00106     }
00107 
00108     uintvec1D tmp;
00109     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3); tmp.push_back(v4);
00110 
00111     if (!checkSurfaceExists(tmp)) surface().push_back(tmp);
00112 }
00113 
00119 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00120                                                       unsigned v3) {
00121     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() || v3 >= X().size()) {
00122         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00123                                 "than size of vertex array");
00124     }
00125 
00126     uintvec1D tmp;
00127     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3);
00128     if (!checkSurfaceExists(tmp)) surface().push_back(tmp);
00129 }
00130 
00134 template <unsigned D> bool vertex_data<D>::checkSurfaceExists(const uintvec1D &newSurface) {
00135 
00136     for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00137 
00139 
00140         vector<bool> found_equal_vertex(surface()[i].size());
00141 
00142         for (unsigned j = 0; j < surface()[i].size(); ++j) {
00143             found_equal_vertex[j] = false;
00144             for (unsigned k = 0; k < newSurface.size(); ++k) {
00145                 if (surface()[i][j] == newSurface[k]) {
00146                     found_equal_vertex[j] = true;
00147                 }
00148             }
00149         }
00150         bool surfaces_are_equal = true;
00151 
00161         for (unsigned i = 0; i < found_equal_vertex.size();
00162              surfaces_are_equal &= found_equal_vertex[i++]) ;
00163         if (surfaces_are_equal) return true;
00164     }
00165     return false;
00166 }

00168 template <unsigned D>
00169     std::vector<VecMath::Vector<4> > vertex_data<D>::vertices() {
00170         Projector<D, 4> p;
00171         return p(X(), 2., 4.);  
00172     }
